Key Match Events: Isaiah Joe fired a career-high 31 points off the bench
Alexander played like an MVP, dropping 39 points in just 29 minutes
A 3-pointer by Joe capped a 12-0 run by the Thunder to end the first quarter with a 14-point lead
The Knicks stared at a 70-43 deficit at the half
Oklahoma City extended it to as many as 30 in the second half
Post-Match Reflections: New York coach Tom Thibodeau said after the beatdown, 'We started flat. Our defense wasn’t very good'
Thibodeau owned the Knicks’ lackluster performance. 'We have to be a lot better defensively, and it requires a lot more than what we did today,' Thibodeau said
Miscellaneous Highlights: The sold-out crowd at the Garden booed the home team multiple times
Former Knicks backup center Isaiah Hartenstein, who left them in the offseason to sign a three-year, $87 million deal with the Thunder, returned to the Garden to a loud ovation and a video tribute
Others: The Knicks, who lost for the fourth time in their last five games, were booed again at the end of the jarring loss
Entering the midway point of the season, their defense currently ranks 15th, six rungs below where they finished last season with less talent
Giannis Antetokounmpo and the Milwaukee Bucks will provide another litmus test for the Knicks on Sunday (Monday Manila time)
